Exciting news for Garfield Re-2 families!
The US Department of Agriculture recently announced that they are extending their Free Meals for Kids program through the end of December 2020 or until available funding runs out. This means all students in Garfield Re-2 can access healthy and nutritious breakfast and lunch at school for no additional cost.
Effective Thursday, September 2, all students in Garfield Re-2 schools will receive free breakfast and lunch, no matter the student's prior free, reduced, or full pay eligibility.
To see what is on the menu, please go here: https://bit.ly/2QLZTJl
Please note: Households who have not yet applied for free or reduced meals for 2020-21 are encouraged to complete an application so eligible students will receive Free/Reduced meals AFTER December 2020, or when available funding runs out under the current guidance. Forms are available here: https://bit.ly/2QLZTJl

Join us tomorrow in celebrating the Coal Ridge High School Class of 2020 with a Colorado HIghway Patrol motorcade from Silt to New Castle.

The Colorado State Patrol in cooperation with the Silt Police Department and the Garfield County Sheriff’s Office will be hosting a “Senior Graduation Motorcade” on Sunday, May 17th. The students can decorate their cars and line up to do a procession through the towns of Silt and New Castle.

Families and community members are encouraged to get out their air horns and line up anywhere between Silt downtown, along Hwy 6 to the New Castle downtown area to cheer them on as they go by!

Seniors are being asked to line up on 1st St. in Silt at 10:15 and they will be promptly pulling out at 11:00. Spectators are asked to park in a safe location off the roadway and
still maintain social distancing during the event. The motorcade will disperse and end at the intersection of Castle Valley Blvd and Highway 6 in time for seniors to enjoy their virtual graduation.

This order also directs the Commissioner of Education to issue guidance to support P-12 school systems in developing and implementing plans to assist families and students in accessing alternative learning, providing free and reduced lunch and breakfast, and offering waivers for instructional time as appropriate.
